text: @KingsResp @natkingcole Walking around North London in freezing temperatures confronts us with the smell of wood fires everywhere. They are pervasive and oppressive, making us cough. text: @BedsFire would like to thank those who gave up their time to support the response to the flooding in our communities. A huge thanks to @BedfordTweets @bedspolice and @EnvAgency local flood groups, volunteer groups and the offers of support we received from the public #ThankYou https://t.co/7QTZrSiXme

@EnvAgencySE This isn't quite as headache inducing as some of your previous gifs, but please consider using static images. The gif doesn't stay on any one frame long enough to read, which makes it basically useless at conveying useful information.

I’ll follow with a few video narratives that will hopefully explain the importance of Earith within the Gt Ouse catchment @EnvAgencyAnglia 

1) Upstream https://t.co/G3vsIzsEAZ

@richardkendall @EnvAgencyAnglia Think it's just the flood plain doing its job from very heavy waterfall and then how the system works - water has to go somewhere. It's rare for it to be this bad, so while we usually use all this land normally, it's designed to work in this way to limit the effect elsewhere.

Just been talking with the @EnvAgencyNW #Cumbria and #Lancashire teams - looks like cold and wintry showers for today.  We also discussed how we can send support to other Area teams who are still dealing with flooding #teamEA https://t.co/SmvY1S1TZW
